description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9m0g5","text":"ABSTRACT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"at64p","text":"This protocol outlines the procedure for microbial DNA enrichment of rectal mucosa tissue samples using NEBNext Microbiome DNA Enrichment Kit (NEB #E2612). The same protocol could be used to enrich microbial DNA from any background human DNA by taking advantage of human DNA having CpG methylation sites that are lacking in microbial DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dj3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4hmf","text":"The protocol covers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41drf","text":"1. Microbial DNA enrichment of extracted samples using NEB NEBNext Microbiome DNA Enrichment kit (NEB #E2612).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c9ur","text":"2. DNA Quantitation of extracted DNA using the Qubit Fluorometer and Agilent Fragment Analyzer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epqgj","text":"3. Sample preperation ready for library preparation for microbiome WGS using NEB NEBNext Ultra II FS DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (NEB #E7805) and DNA sequencing on the Illumina NextSeq2000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fue1t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p3si","text":"Previous DNA extraction steps are outlines in protocol dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.eq2lyj15wlx9/v1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":48}],"data":{}},{"key":"fqlof","text":"1. DNA extraction from faecal samples using MP Biomedicals FastDNA Spin Kit and FastPrep-24 for bead-beating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euek5","text":"2. DNA extraction from rectal mucosa biopsy tissue using a modification of MP Biomedicals FastDNA Spin Kit and FastPrep-24 for bead-beating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3CA4DC4E95DC11EEBAA80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.eq2lyj15wlx9/v1"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8saf","text":"Samples were extracted using the protocol \"DNA extraction from rectal mucosa biopsies and matched faecal samples taken from surgery for microbiome analysis”. https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.eq2lyj15wlx9/v1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":158,"length":56}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5331352098F711EEBC5E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.eq2lyj15wlx9/v1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9l4q2","text":"For every 6.25ng of input DNA, you will need 1 µl of MBD2-Fc-bound magnetic beads for enrichment.      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t2tq","text":"The amount of MBD2-Fc-bound magnetic beads required can be calculated using the following equation: Y= Input DNA (ng)/6.25ng/ul ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f629r","text":"i.e. for recommended input of 1000ng/6.25ng/ul = 160ul of MBD2-Fc-bound magnetic beads per reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnk7t","text":"Briefly spin the tubes/plate and then incubate at    on the\nmagnetic rack for   until the beads have collected to the wall and the\nsolution is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"94C526A0D0C211EEA6800A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cfbqv","text":"Vortex AMPure XP beads to resuspend. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6pc0","text":"Perform qPCR with the following settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e61bl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2sbnu","text":" qPCR was carried out on the QuantStudio 12K Flex (Thermo Fisher). Analyse results as appropriate for your qPCR reagents and instrument. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":""},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[112,112,112,112],"data":[[" Cycle Step "," Temperature "," Time "," Cycles "],[" Initial Denaturation "," 95⁰C "," 60 seconds "," 1 "],[" Denaturation "," 95⁰C "," 15 seconds "," 45 "],[" Extension "," 60⁰C "," 30 seconds ",""],[" Melt Curve "," 60-95⁰C "," Various "," 1 "]],"guid":"62851F5BA1D44624B463CC939B734E28","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{"D_3":[1,2]},"printData":[[" Cycle Step "," Temperature "," Time "," Cycles "],[" Initial Denaturation "," 95⁰C "," 60 seconds "," 1 "],[" Denaturation "," 95⁰C "," 15 seconds "," 45 "],[" Extension "," 60⁰C "," 30 seconds ",""],[" Melt Curve "," 60-95⁰C "," Various "," 1 "]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"760ko","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant with a pipette without disturbing the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5usim","text":"Prepare 1 µg input DNA in up to   DNase free water in the tube/plate if not prepared at step 5 (TE Buffer pH 7.5 can also be used).    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8hg3s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j1i2","text":"If using a 1ug DNA input, add 160µl of MBD2-Fc-bound magnetic beads to each DNA sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3vcj","text":"For other DNA input amounts, add DNA (up to 200ul) to (Y) µl of MBD2-Fc bound magnetic beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tmgp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dihpr","text":"Note: The equation to calculate the number of beads required (Y) is highlighted in step 6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9i24g","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant with a pipette without disturbing the bead and transfer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6v9sn","text":"it to a clean tube/plate. Keep the supernatent - this is enriched for microbial DNA and can be purified by bead clean-up. The sample can be stored at  or can proceed directly to purification (bead clean-up).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":150,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"862ek","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a7e6","text":"Samples can now be processed for library preparation using NEB NEBNext Ultra II FS DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina with sequencing on the Illumina NextSeq2000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d536","text":"There is no defined results to define succesful enrichment. In general, for microbial DNA there should be minimal change in Cq value using the 16s primers in non-enriched input samlpes and enriched samples. For human DNA there should be a change in Cq value observed using the RPL30 human primers in enriched samples compared to unenriched samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12tdf","text":"Quantify   of extracted DNA sample using either Qubit dsDNA Broad Range assay kit or dsDNA High Sensitivity assay kit on the Qubit Flex Fluorometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pp2c","text":"Determine DNA quality and quantity using an Agilent Fragment Analyzer, use 2ul DNA sample with the Genomic DNA Kit (50kb) kit (#5191-6569). Using the associated PROsize Data Analysis Software, check that DNA fragments are \u003e15kb before processing. This is important as enrichment will be less efficient for fragments smaller than this. (A 0.8% agarose gel can be used as an alternative).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4svm0","text":"Normalise samples to   input DNA with prepared Tris-EDTA Buffer pH7.5. Make up at least 40ul volume. Retain at least  of DNA for step 36 (Validation of enrichment by qPCR).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6d090","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94rs4","text":"Add undiluted Bind/wash Buffer (5X) to the DNA/bead mix for a final concentration of 1X.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28ifh","text":"Volume of 5X Bind/wash Buffer to add (µl) = Volume of input DNA (µl)/4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17msq","text":"i.e. add 10 µl of Bind/wash Buffer (5X) per reaction if the DNA input sample volume was 40 µl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"553t2","text":"Pipette the sample up and down until the beads are completely homogenous, at least 10 times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frqpk","text":"Agitate the tubes on a rotating mixer for   at  . Pipette mix every 2 minutes if the samples are in a plate and can't be placed on the rotating mixer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"459rs","text":"Add 1.8X volume of resuspended AMPure XP beads to each sample. Mix well by pipetting up and down at 10 times, then incubate at   for  .\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":127,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":133,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1h6hg","text":"* If the combined volume of beads and DNA does not exceed the capacity of the well, large numbers of bead clean-ups can be conducted in parallel on a microplate e.g. 0.8ml 96-well storage plates (#AB-0765 Thermo) . Alternately, the DNA/bead mix can be transferred to individual tubes for bead clean-up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":302}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"909ek","text":"Place the tubes/plate on the magnetic stand. After   (or when the solution is clear), transfer eluate to a new tube/plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6l5r","text":"Mix well by pipetting up and down 10 times. Incubate for at least   at   . If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tubes or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2gse8","text":"Remove the tubes/plate from the magnetic stand and resuspend the beads in 30 µl of 1X TE buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4i5t","text":"(NEB- TE Buffer (1X) #E7808AAVIAL, not supplied in kit)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crgqq","text":"Air dry the beads for   while the tubes/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open. Spin at full speed for    in order to collect residual 70% ethanol. Then place on the magnetic stand for   before pipetting the residual 70% ethanol and air-drying for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":113,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":195,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":258,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"15usv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l432","text":"* Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. If beads turn brown and start to crack, they are too dry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"darvh","text":"Repeat Step 29 once for a total of two washes. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tubes/plate, place back on the magnetic stand and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8imd4","text":"Add   of freshly prepared 70% ethanol to the tubes/plate while in the magnetic stand. Ensure there is sufficient volume to cover the bead pellet. Incubate at   for  , and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the\nbeads that contain DNA targets. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":158,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":164,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8f114","text":"After   (or when the solution is clear) carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsk1p","text":"Place the tube/plate on the magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tubes or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"773g6","text":"Remove the tube(s) from the rack and add (Y)ul of 1X Bind/wash Buffer (kept on ice) per reaction to resuspend the beads. Mix by pipetting up and down a few times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apmse","text":"Note: The equation to calculate (Y) is highlighted in step 6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a13t1","text":"Repeat steps 14–17 twice for a total of three washes to ensure the removal of unbound MBD2-Fc protein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c94ck","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatant with a pipette without disturbing the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3uvlf","text":"Briefly spin the tube(s) and place on the magnetic rack for   (or until the beads have collected to the wall of the tube and the solution is clear). {"blocks":[{"key":"8qu67","text":"Mix by pipetting up and down until the beads are completely homogeneous, at least 10 times. {"blocks":[{"key":"an9e","text":"Resuspend the amount of NEBNext Protein A Magnetic Beads required by rotating the tube(s) on a rotating mixer gently for   at  . Do not vortex.
